Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,04,974 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. T002.initial_thoughts: Okay, I will analyze the retrieved data about the Mahindra XUV 3XO and extract key features related to engine specifications, safety, technology, design, and unique selling propositions. summary_bullets: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh (ex-showroom India).
It is available in 12 trim levels.
Engine options include a 111hp 1.2-litre turbo-petrol, a 131hp 1.2-litre TGDI petrol, and a 117hp 1.5-litre diesel engine.

## Risk Factors and Uncertainties

- Competition from established players

## Strategic Recommendations

- Focus on highlighting unique features in marketing campaigns
- Expand the service network to ensure customer satisfaction
- Continuously innovate to stay ahead of the competition

output.formatted_report_T003:
üìä Mahindra XUV 3XO Analysis Report

üéØ Executive Summary

This report provides a detailed overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering its key features, specifications, and unique selling points. The XUV 3XO is priced competitively, offers multiple engine options, and is packed with safety and technology features. It stands out with its design and interior features. The vehicle aims to capture a significant share in the competitive sub-compact SUV market in India. Key recommendations include focusing on marketing unique features and continuously innovating.

üí∞ Pricing and Trim Levels

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh (ex-showroom India). It is available in 12 trim levels, offering a wide range of options to cater to different customer preferences and budgets.

Engine and Performance

The XUV 3XO offers multiple engine options:

  • 1.2-litre turbo-petrol: 111hp
  • 1.2-litre TGDI petrol: 131hp
  • 1.5-litre diesel engine: 117hp

The 1.2L TGDI engine accelerates from 0 to 60 km/h in 4.5 seconds. A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard across the engine range. Petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel gets a 6-speed AMT unit.

Safety Features

Key safety features include:

  • 6 airbags
  • Electronic Stability Control (ESC) with Hill Hold Control (HHC)
  • All 4 disc brakes

High-end trims come with Level 2 ADAS. The vehicle meets the highest B-NCAP safety rating, ensuring a secure driving experience.

Design Highlights

The design highlights of the XUV 3XO include:

  • Bold silhouette
  • Ivory-colored interiors with soft-touch leatherette
  • R17 alloy wheels
  • First-in-segment SkyroofTM (sunroof)

The SUV has a best-in-class wheelbase, occupant space, and legroom, with a cargo area of 364L.

Technology and Features

Key technology features include:

  • Twin HD Screens (26.03 cm infotainment and digital cluster)
  • Harman Kardon Premium Audio
  • 360-degree surround view system
  • Dual Zone Climate Control
  • 65 W USB-C charging
  • Electronic Parking brake with Auto Hold
  • 3 Smart Steering Modes

The XUV 3XO offers a best-in-class forward visibility of 23.7 degrees.

Competitive Positioning

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with other sub-compact SUVs in the Indian market, such as the Tata Nexon, Maruti Suzuki Brezza, Hyundai Venue, and Kia Sonet. The XUV 3XO aims to offer a superior value proposition by combining performance, safety, and technology at a competitive price point. Its unique features, such as the SkyroofTM and Level 2 ADAS, differentiate it from the competition. The aggressive pricing strategy further enhances its competitive edge, making it an attractive option for customers seeking a feature-rich and stylish SUV.

‚öôÔ∏è Specifications Table

‚ö†Ô∏è Risk Factors and Uncertainties

The success of the Mahindra XUV 3XO depends on several factors, including market acceptance of new technologies, competition from established players, and economic conditions affecting consumer spending. Potential risks include:

  • Market Acceptance: The adoption of advanced technologies like Level 2 ADAS and electric powertrains may face resistance from some customers.
  • Competition: The sub-compact SUV segment is highly competitive, with established players like Maruti Suzuki, Hyundai, and Tata Motors.
  • Economic Conditions: Economic downturns or rising fuel prices could negatively impact consumer demand for automobiles.
  • Supply Chain Disruptions: Disruptions in the supply chain could lead to production delays and increased costs.
  • Regulatory Changes: Changes in government regulations related to safety or emissions could require costly modifications.

It is crucial for Mahindra to closely monitor these risk factors and implement mitigation strategies to ensure the long-term success of the XUV 3XO.

üéØ Strategic Recommendations

To maximize the success of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, the following strategic recommendations are proposed:

  • Marketing Focus: Emphasize the unique features and value proposition of the XUV 3XO in marketing campaigns. Highlight the SkyroofTM, Level 2 ADAS, and competitive pricing.
  • Service Network Expansion: Expand the service network to ensure customer satisfaction and build brand loyalty.
  • Continuous Innovation: Continuously innovate and introduce new features to stay ahead of the competition and meet evolving customer needs.
  • Partnerships: Forge partnerships with technology providers and suppliers to enhance the XUV 3XO's capabilities and reduce costs.
  • Customer Engagement: Engage with customers through social media and other channels to gather feedback and improve the product.

# Mahindra XUV 3XO Report

## Executive Summary

A detailed report on the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering its key features, specifications, and unique selling points.

## Pricing and Trim Levels

- Priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh (ex-showroom India).
- Available in 12 trim levels.

## Engine and Performance

- Engine options include a 111hp 1.2-litre turbo-petrol, a 131hp 1.2-litre TGDI petrol, and a 117hp 1.5-litre diesel engine.
- The 1.2L TGDI engine accelerates from 0 to 60 km/h in 4.5 seconds.
- 6-speed manual gearbox is standard across the engine range.
- Petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel gets a 6-speed AMT unit.

## Safety Features

- Key safety features include 6 airbags, Electronic Stability Control (ESC) with Hill Hold Control (HHC), and all 4 disc brakes.
- High-end trims come with Level 2 ADAS.
- It meets highest B-NCAP safety rating.

## Design Highlights

- Design highlights include a bold silhouette, ivory-colored interiors with soft-touch leatherette, and R17 alloy wheels.
- It features a first-in-segment SkyroofTM (sunroof).
- The SUV has a best-in-class wheelbase, occupant space, and legroom, with a cargo area of 364L.

## Technology and Features

- Technology includes Twin HD Screens (26.03 cm infotainment and digital cluster), Harman Kardon Premium Audio, and a 360-degree surround view system.
- Other tech features: Dual Zone Climate Control, 65 W USB-C charging, Electronic Parking brake with Auto Hold, 3 Smart Steering Modes.
- The XUV 3XO offers a best-in-class forward visibility of 23.7 degrees.

## Competitive Positioning

- The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with other sub-compact SUVs in the Indian market, offering a blend of performance, safety, and technology at a competitive price point.  It aims to attract customers looking for a feature-rich vehicle with a stylish design.

## Risk Factors and Uncertainties

- Market acceptance of new technologies
- Competition from established players
- Economic conditions affecting consumer spending

## Strategic Recommendations

- Focus on highlighting unique features in marketing campaigns
- Expand the service network to ensure customer satisfaction
- Continuously innovate to stay ahead of the competition

Engine and Performance

The XUV 3XO offers multiple engine options:

  • 1.2-litre turbo-petrol: 111hp
  • 1.2-litre TGDI petrol: 131hp

Safety Features

  • 6 airbags

  • Ivory-colored interiors with soft-touch leatherette
  • R17 alloy wheels

Technology and Features

  • Twin HD Screens (26.03 cm infotainment and digital cluster)
  • Harman Kardon Premium Audio
  • 360-degree surround view system
  • Dual Zone Climate Control
  • 65 W USB-C charging
  • Electronic Parking brake with Auto Hold
  • 3 Smart Steering Modes

The XUV 3XO offers a best-in-class forward visibility of 23.7 degrees.

Competitive Positioning

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with other sub-compact SUVs in the Indian market, such as the Tata Nexon, Maruti Suzuki Brezza, Hyundai Venue, and Kia Sonet. The XUV 3XO aims to offer a superior value proposition by combining performance, safety, and technology at a competitive price point.   • Twin HD Screens (26.03 cm infotainment and digital cluster)
  • Harman Kardon Premium Audio
  • 360-degree surround view system
  • Dual Zone Climate Control
  • 65 W USB-C charging
  • Electronic Parking brake with Auto Hold
  • 3 Smart Steering Modes

The XUV 3XO offers a best-in-class forward visibility of 23.7 degrees.

Competitive Positioning

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with other sub-compact SUVs in the Indian market, such as the Tata Nexon, Maruti Suzuki Brezza, Hyundai Venue, and Kia Sonet. The XUV 3XO aims to offer a superior value proposition by combining performance, safety, and technology at a competitive price point. Its unique features, such as the SkyroofTM and Level 2 ADAS, differentiate it from the competition. The aggressive pricing strategy further enhances its competitive edge, making it an attractive option for customers seeking a feature-rich and stylish SUV.

‚ö†Ô∏è Risk Factors and Uncertainties

The success of the Mahindra XUV 3XO depends on several factors, including market acceptance of new technologies, competition from established players, and economic conditions affecting consumer spending. Potential risks include:

  • Market Acceptance: The adoption of advanced technologies like Level 2 ADAS and electric powertrains may face resistance from some customers.
  • Competition: The sub-compact SUV segment is highly competitive, with established players like Maruti Suzuki, Hyundai, and Tata Motors.
  • Economic Conditions: Economic downturns or rising fuel prices could negatively impact consumer demand for automobiles.
  • Supply Chain Disruptions: Disruptions in the supply chain could lead to production delays and increased costs.
  • Regulatory Changes: Changes in government regulations related to safety or emissions could require costly modifications.

It is crucial for Mahindra to closely monitor these risk factors and implement mitigation strategies to ensure the long-term success of the XUV 3XO.
